It was the last stand of the Dryatics, the northernmost of the Palaic peoples, who rebelled against the Empire and were overcome. According to legend they were pushed back into the shallows of the lake and fought until they were exhausted and the bloody waters engulfed them.

Chaikand sits by the reed-marshes on the edge of Lake Tanaesis. In the years when the east was an imperial protectorate, boats laden with hides, wool and salt shuttled across the lake&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;apos;s placid waters, returning with imperial silks and silver. With the coming of the Khuzaits and the subsequent wars the water-trade stopped, but Chaikand remains a major trade entrepot and military base, the fief of the ruling Urkhunait clan. From the pavilions of his palace, the khan can look out across the lake and see the hazy outline of hills that he may one day graze his horses upon.

Car Banseth nằm trên vách núi Ailta Druin. Nếu ai đó nhìn về phía bắc vào một ngày nắng chói chang, nhìn bao quát vùng đất từng thuộc về Battanian nhưng nay đã bị người Vlandians và Sturians chiếm đóng, người ta có thể nhìn thấy ánh sáng lấp lánh của Vịnh Valcheg lấp lánh. Tương truyền, những người có đức tin sẽ nhìn thấy hạm đội của Vua Meng đã chết từ đây vào một ngày nào đó, và ông sẽ trở lại thế giới và cứu người dân của mình khỏi nước sôi lửa bỏng. Nhưng giờ đây, nhiều khả năng sẽ thấy các nhà thám hiểm và lính đánh thuê của Nordic ở đây. Mục đích của họ là giúp người nước ngoài từng bước xâm chiếm Battanian.

Baltakhand, the Fortress of the Axe, was settled by the Iltanlar, mountain-dwelling cousins of the Khuzaits. Centuries ago their beys descended into the plains and created the fortress here that guards the portages of Iltan, the network of lakes and rivers that divides the Sturgian lands from the Khuzaits&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;apos; realm. Bitter winters protected them from the reach of the Empire, but no blast of wind was cutting enough to stop the horsemen of Khan Urkhun, who 40 years ago forced this town to submit to the khanate.

Balgard, which sits on the icy waters of Mazopor bay, was founded by migrants from the Nordlands. Legend holds that the initial wave of Nords arrogantly demanded tribute from the nearby Vakken and Sturgian tribes, who formed an alliance and drove the newcomers back to their ships. But the victors fell out over the spoils, until a canny Nord, Gundar, landed and volunteered to help them fairly divvy up the weapons and armor of his dead kinsmen. The residents recognized Gundar&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;apos;s lordship over the region and his descendants, intermarried with the Sturgians, are today the grand princes of Sturgia.

Askar vượt cao hơn phần giữa của sông Damar, nơi nước len lỏi qua các vách đá. Dân cư khu vực này cư ngụ ở đây+hàng nghìn năm, nhưng những dòng sông chảy xiết không bao giờ ngừng, cứ vài trăm năm lại vỡ đôi một lần, xóa đi những dấu tích trước đó. Đô thị khu vực gần đây nhất là một trại được xây dựng bởi Đế Quốc trong cuộc xâm nhập sâu nhất vào Nahasa hàng trăm năm trước, và bộ tộc Aserai đã chiếm đóng nó sau khi quân đoàn rút lui.

Amprela is the foremost town of the far northeast of the Empire. Watchmen stand atop its towers, looking out for beacons from the frontier fortresses to the north, east and west that might signal the approach of raiders. Horse archers recruited from the rough Eleftheroi freemen drink in the barracks, waiting for the order to ride out against horsemen from the steppe. Cataphracts sally through its gates to vie with the princes of Sturgia for control of the trade crossing the nearby network of lakes known as the Iltan portages.

Syronea sits on the eastern shores of Lake Tanaesis. This city, once peaceful and rich, was once a byword for luxury and decadence. This was the center of the Empire&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;apos;s silk industry and an entrepot for the goods flowing in from what was known as Transtanaesia, the imperial possessions and protectorates beyond the great lake. But the coming of the Khuzaits ripped the Transtanaesia from the Empire&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;apos;s grasp and the Senatorial families of Syronea were forced to relearn the arts of war, dusting off old gilded armors and sharpening bejewelled swords to lead their followers against Urkhun&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;apos;s warriors.
